column4: anyone feel like helping me troubleshoot my sound card problem?  I can't get any sound system to work, and what I really want is alsa to work.
tells us what card it is , which platform , which ubuntu you are using
turtle beach sound card, k7, and breezy.
turtle beech use some quite unsual designs , which one is it ?
santa cruz.  it's listed, sorta, on the alsa hardware list
yeah, it lists it as " Multimedia audio controller: Cirrus Logic CS 4614/22/24"
how do you know its not working ?
make sure its a wav file
have you checked that the amp / headphones / speakers are working ok ?
they work when I boot to windows, yes.
did it ever work or did it stop working ?
OSS worked, but only for one sound at a time.  I tried to install ALSA, and now both do not work.
but you can still use alsamixer and the settings stick between invocations ?
I'm not sure what you mean.  everything stays the same way through reboots, yes.
okay, now my onboard sound card is working.  but the thing that selects which card to output on doesn't do anything.

that setting is not sticking.  it shows both sound devices, lets me select either, but it always falls back to the onboard device.  I know I could disable it in the bios, but I'd actually like to have both cards working.
